Prospera OS
Commercial Boundary Pack v0.1

File: system/external/commercial-boundary-pack-v0.1.md
Status: Draft
Owner: Prospera Architecture Group
Category: System Specification

This document defines the commercial boundary language for Prospera OS.

It specifies what may and may not be stated in commercial, sales,
partnership, and contractual contexts while remaining compliant with
governance, authority, and liability constraints.


Purpose

The purpose of this document is to provide a standardized, safe language
pack for commercial usage of Prospera OS.

This pack ensures that all external-facing commercial communication
remains accurate, defensible, and aligned with Phase D boundaries.


Scope

This specification applies to:

- Sales presentations and proposals
- Partnership discussions and materials
- Commercial contracts and statements of work
- Marketing-adjacent technical descriptions
- Investor and stakeholder briefings

This document does not replace legal contracts.
It constrains the language used to describe Prospera OS commercially.


Commercial Claim Categories

Commercial statements regarding Prospera OS are classified into three
categories:

1. Approved Statements
2. Conditional Statements
3. Prohibited Statements

Only approved statements may be used without qualification.


Approved Commercial Statements

The following statements may be used verbatim in commercial contexts:

- Prospera OS provides governance evaluation and enforcement mechanisms.
- Prospera OS determines whether actions may proceed, escalate, or halt.
- Prospera OS enforces authority and policy boundaries prior to execution.
- Prospera OS improves auditability and traceability of decisions.
- Prospera OS supports governance-first AI-assisted workflows.

These statements describe system behavior without implying outcomes.


Conditional Commercial Statements

The following statements may be used only with explicit qualification:

- Prospera OS can support compliance readiness when properly configured.
- Prospera OS may reduce governance-related operational risk.
- Prospera OS can improve consistency of decision evaluation.

Conditional statements must include context such as:

- Configuration dependency
- Organizational responsibility
- Absence of guarantees


Prohibited Commercial Statements

The following statements are strictly prohibited in any commercial context:

- Prospera OS guarantees compliance or correctness.
- Prospera OS ensures business success or performance improvement.
- Prospera OS replaces human decision-making.
- Prospera OS acts autonomously or intelligently.
- Prospera OS eliminates risk or liability.

Any use of prohibited statements constitutes a governance violation.


Contractual Language Constraints

Contracts and statements of work involving Prospera OS must adhere to
the following constraints:

- Prospera OS is described as an evaluation and governance system only.
- Responsibility for execution and outcomes remains with the client.
- No warranty is implied beyond system availability and configuration.
- Liability exclusions must reference Phase D boundaries.

Any deviation requires explicit legal review.


Sales and Partnership Guidance

Sales and partnership teams must:

- Use approved statements as primary descriptions
- Avoid speculative or outcome-based claims
- Defer technical enforcement details
- Escalate ambiguous requests to governance review

No commercial representative may redefine system authority.


Enforcement

Violations of this pack may result in:

- Withdrawal of commercial authorization
- Correction of published materials
- Termination of partnership discussions
- Governance escalation

This pack is enforceable under governance authority.


Relationship to Other Specifications

This document is subordinate to:

- External Claim & Liability Boundary Specification v0.1
- External Entry Map v0.1
- Use-Case Framing Specification v0.1
- Governance Index and Semantic Baselines

In case of conflict, governance and liability specifications
take precedence.
